DOC.HEAD: Smithsonian Says 11 Scientists, Technicians Missing
With AM-US-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: The Smithsonian Institution reported Wednesday that 11 scientists and technicians associated with the its Tropical Research Institute in Panama are missing and are believed to have been abducted. ``These people have disappeared, and we're very concerned,'' said Smithsonian spokeswoman Madeleine Jacobs. ``We have every reason to believe they were taken hostage.'' Ms. Jacobs said the scientists, five Americans, five Panamanians and one Venezuelan, were working at a marine research facility on the Sanblas chain of islands off the Panamanian coast in the Caribbean when they were abducted by armed troops. A Smithsonian employee on the island called the research institute's director in Panama City at midmorning by radio telephone to warn that the troops were approaching in a boat. A couple of hours later, a technician on the island called briefly to say they were being transferred to the mainland and taken by truck to an unknown destination. Ms. Jacobs said most of the 190 other Smithsonian employees and visiting scientists in Panama had been accounted for.
